page.title: 15TRANSPORT - SERVICES
page.content: With the demise of the mining industry in the Kelty area there has been a decline in transport services. Kelty had a railway station, now closed, on the Perth, Edinburgh route. The village had an Alexanders Bus Garage which has also closed within the last few years. With the closure of this garage, Kelty was left virtually isolated. There is a half hour bus service to Cowdenbeath, an hourly service to Dunfermline. There is also a two hour service with buses passing from Perth to Edinburgh. Most traffic now by passes Kelty.
